div.head: Memorandum From Richard Morefield (Director of Systematic Review) to Richard Murphy (Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern Affairs)
div.p: Subject: Foreign Relations of the United States, Volume X, Iran, 1951-1954; Final Clearance for Publication

After some nine years, including delays occasioned by events in the Middle East, CDC has completed its review of the documents proposed by the Historical Office for publication in a volume of Foreign Relations of the United States covering U.S. relations with Iran during 1951-1954. In addition to review within the Department of State and CIA, documents of interest to the Department of Defense, the Export-Import Bank, and the IBRD have been reviewed by those organizations. Finally, numerous documents of interest to the United Kingdom have been reviewed by the British Foreign Office.

The history of this volume is particularly complex. The section covering 1951 was originally reviewed and cleared before the Iranian Revolution. Although already put into page proof form by HO, action was suspended and the volume was re-reviewed in 1983. Meanwhile, documents covering 1952-1954 had been assembled and reviewed as part of a larger Near East volume from which it was later separated. The years 1951 to 1954 were consolidated into a single volume in 1984 and, in large part, re-reviewed. At different times all parts of the volume have been cleared in NEA contingent upon subsequent clearance by NSC. Now, with NSC clearance the volume is ready for final clearance to publication.

The criteria applied in reviewing this volume are those set out in Mr. Peter Constable’s memorandum of February 10, 1981 to Mr. McManaway (CDC). (TAB A) Close coordination has been maintained, as specified in Mr. Constable’s memorandum, with Mr. Charles Naas of CDC/MR and most of the documentation has been personally reviewed by him.

For your information, there is attached a copy of the Guidelines to Archives covering the period, TAB B. Also available is the documentation of the review process conducted with other agencies and governments.
It is requested that approval, in the form of NEA clearance on the memorandum at TAB C, be given to transmit the documents, indicating actions taken, to the Historical Office for publication.
